inn1.comm: decent start, accurate, just outside off, defended off the front foot
looks to cut this short ball but can't get any timing on it
short and wide, cut away in front of third man
short of a length, angling in, runs off the inside edge to fine leg
on a length, angling in, defended towards mid-on
fuller, into the pads, flicked to mid-on

lovely flick. On a length, a touch too straight, Shehzad whips it past mid-on. Seems like he is not aware of the extremely slow outfield. He just jogs to admire what looks like a certain boundary, and hence has to do with just two when he can get three
lovely square drive past point. Superbly timed, but the slow outfield keeps them down to two again
on a length, angling in, looks for a big drive, is hit on in the inside half of the bat
driven on the up. This is nowhere near driving length, but he has managed to drive this crisply. Straight to the fielder at cover, though
flash drive attempted with no foot movement, and is beaten by a wide delivery
another drive on the up, with an open face, but can't beat the man at point
on a length, into the pads, dropped into the leg side for a single
length ball outside off, pushed with an open face to point
just holds its line outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
driven on the up but straight to extra cover
flicked away from outside off, but straight to mid-on
pushed slightly wide of mid-on, and also because the fielder is Malinga, an easy single results
yet another crisp drive straight to cover. Shehzad has to start finding gaps
see Shehzad is getting frustrated. He has hit some crisp drives straight to fielders, and now he looks to go over the top but is beaten by one that is not full enough to be driven
straight to the fielder again, with an open face to point
bouncer, that has risen alarmingly, beats the pull, and the wicketkeeper too. It's called byes, which means it wasn't too short or too high when it crossed the batsman. This is a quick pitch
full and fast, a half-volley, but driven straight to short cover again
short of a length, outside off, he looks for the drive, the ball seams in and beats the inside edge
short of a length, pushed wide of mid-on for one

that should release the pressure a little. A full ball into the pads and whipped away for what looks an easy second, but Shehzad is slow and has got himself into a tangle again. He has again thought it is gone for four, but it hasn't. This is a slow outfield. Just about makes it in time with a dive
a bit of a slog as he looks to drag this from outside off and over midwicket. Beaten
a legcutter. This time Shehzad opens the face, gets it wide of point, but Azhar sends him back this time. What's more he gets told off by the umpire for running on the danger area of the pitch
almighty swipe, but mistimed for a single straight of mid-on

short of a length, soft hands, towards mid-on, takes a quick single, and Shehzad has run down the middle of the pitch again. Another caution from the umpire. A bowler would have been warned officially, but not the batsmen. Strange. Gets just a smiling word of caution
length ball, angling in, defended to mid-on
down the wicket, Pradeep goes short, but Azhar goes ahead with a pull despite being cramped. Somehow he has managed a good connection and gets a boundary back over the bowler's head
again they pick on Malinga. Take a single after hitting this straight to him at mid-on
slower ball, short of a length, pretty straight, but at the last moment the bat comes down to work it around the corner on the leg side
looks to pull, is hurried into it, manages just a bottom edge wide of short midwicket. Shehzad wants a single, but the shot has pushed Azhar deep into the crease. Sent back
nicely played. This is a legcutter without a slip, Shehzad waits for it to arrive and opens the face late to beat the keeper and get his first boundary
looks for the regulation cut this time, gets a bottom edge towards short third for a single
angling in, too straight, worked away for a single to leg
stays leg side of a length ball on the stumps, but can't manage a powerful drive. Plays it to short cover
down the wicket despite the keeper's standing up, and despite Mathews' adjustment with a short ball he has pulled it well over mid-on for four
Shehzad has spent some time failing to find gaps, but now he has begun to go over the top. This time lofts a length ball over mid-on for four more
that looks like a plumb lbw. This is not a a very smart shot. Walking right across to Malinga who can spear them in full and straight. Manages a thick inside edge here, though
short, outside off, runs this down to third man
across the stumps again, but this time Malinga has offered a leg-side half-volley and he flicks it for four to become the fastest Pakistani to 1000 ODI runs. Gets an applause from his bench
short of a length, at the stumps, defended
short of a length, outside off, 132ks, he presses forward and defends
on a length, outside off, defended from the crease
flat length ball, no turn, defended from the crease

that's a near suicidal run. Pushed straight to short midwicket. Neither is the bowler there to collect the throw nor is the throw direct. Poor stuff from Pathirana. Bowlers nowadays don't like getting behind the stumps
down the wicket to defend this back to him
dances down the track to take this on the full and drive it wide of long-off. The slow outfield means they get just one. Should have still been two
down the wicket to push this wide of mid-on for one
quicker, flatter, on off, defended to point
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
on a length, just outside off, pushed straight of mid-on for one
down the wicket, Malinga bangs this is short after seeing him, but Azhar goes ahead with a cut in front of square. Beats extra cover and gets four more
short of a length, into his pads, flicked away to deep square leg
slower offcutter, on a length, pitches middle, moves towards leg, defended to leg
another slower ball, Shehzad reads it and clubs it to mid-on where Thisara Perera misfields to allow them two runs
on a length, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
down the wicket, Perera goes short, but he manages to cut this beautifully past point for four
short, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man for one
slower ball, just outside off, gets a leading edge back to the bowler but not on the full
slower short ball again, gloves the pull for a single towards long leg
on a length, angling in, runs off the inside edge for a single
short of a length, straight, pushed to mid-on
a touch short, a touch wide, but can't beat the man at point
helped around the corner on the leg side for a single
swept away from outside off, but straight to square leg
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
short of a length, just outside off, seams away a touch to beat his attempt at dabbing it down to third man
down the wicket, loses his shape, his head falls away, but he still manages to clear extra cover with a cramped drive
short, pulled away to deep midwicket
he sees him leave the crease and slips in a wide slower ball. Harsh call to call it a wide. A bit of a split-finger slower ball. Well bowled
bouncer, head high, hooked wide of deep midwicket for two
this is a slower wide ball again. Shehzad lets it go but it cuts back in to avoid being called a wide. Well bowled
pulled straight to square leg
half-volley, driven square, past point, gets a second before cover-point gets around
full, angling in, pushed towards long-on for a single
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, pushes in front of the body, straight to cover-point
that's too short, into the body too, and he has rocked back to pull this over midwicket for four
down the wicket, top the pitch of the ball, gets a single to long-off
flatter, into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, towards the chest, he is off his feet and fends it down
bouncer, but wide down the leg side
slower ball, short of a length, dabbed away to third man for one
short of a length, sticks in the surface, takes the leading edge, but it doesn't carry to short midwicket
bouncer, pretty accurate this time, just outside off, but this time he has been wided on the height
slower full ball, squeezed past point for a single to square third man
short of a length, outside off, steered in front of third man, comes back for the second
shimmies a little, Perera bowls a slower offcutter outside off, gets the inside edge, but it beats the stumps
short and wide, he rocks back to cut this between cover point and backward point. The slow outfield keeps them down to three
down the wicket, drives down the ground, but can't beat Pathirana to his left
sweeps this from in front of the stumps, gets a single to short fine leg
pushes at a length ball in front of the body, gets an inside edge
slower in the air, looks to drive this to long-off but can't beat the short straight cover
flatter, pulled away to midwicket
short ball, gets inside the line, keeps the pull down, gets a single
pulled down into the ground again, gets a single to long leg

this is not the smartest piece of batting. The midwicket is back, the square leg is back, Malinga is bowling short, but Shehzad still goes ahead and pulls limply. There is neither an attempt to keep this down nor is it a full-blooded pull looking for the six. Gives deep midwicket catching practice there
short of a length, outside off, sweetly punched to point
bouncer, Hafeez ducks it, Chandimal collects outside off
lovely bouncer, middle and leg, Hafeez looks to pull, is beaten by the bounce. Lucky not to glove it
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
short ball, down the leg side. Pradeep is lucky Azhar hasn't got a touch on this. Wide nonetheless
runs this down to third man for one
wide length ball, left alone
another wide length ball, left alone again
Hafeez is lucky. The field is set for a bouncer, Hafeez plays a shot quite similar to Shehzad's but this top edge falls between deep midwicket and deep square leg
has creamed this pull. For starters this is only chest high, and he has got on top of the bounce, and pulled it down into the ground and between deep square leg and deep midwicket
bouncer, keeps the pull down, but can't beat square leg
drops this shortish ball into the leg side for a single
slower ball, on a length, middle and leg, dropped into the leg side for a single
pulls with the front leg in the air, rolls his wrists on it, gets a single to long leg
slower ball, worked past midwicket for one
pulled down to long leg for one
short of a length, outside off, defended
bouncer, he ducks under it
short of a length, outside off, defended
pulls this short ball from outside off, but can't beat the man inside the circle on the leg side
short of a length, wide, punched away to deep point
short of a length, wide outside off, runs this down to third man
down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the ball, defends it back
flatter, on off, goes back to punch this but can't beat point
slight turn from a length on middle and off, defended back to him
pulls the length back, he goes back to cut, but can't beat the Siriwardana dive at cover-point. They get a single despite confusion
worked past mid-on for one
cut away, Pradeep dives too early at backward point, but manages to keep them down to one
wide length ball, holds its line, beats Hafeez's drive
short of a length, wide, punched straight to extra cover
slower ball, half-volley, driven straight to cover
Hafeez is lucky. Pradeep gets the bouncer high this time, Hafeez gets a top edge on the pull but it lands between deep midwicket and deep square leg
short of a length, slower ball, runs this down to third man for one
full and wide, driven to deep cover
length ball, accurate, no turn, goes back to defend it
smart shot by Hafeez. he has seen the long-off is wide, steps out of the crease, reaches the pitch of the ball and hits him through long-off for four
flatter, into the pads, beats his pull. Just not short enough
stays back to open the face on a flat delivery, can't beat cover-point
flat, into the pads, short too, and he has pulled it past square leg for four. That shot earlier in the over has messed around with the young spinner's lengths
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover

short of a length, into the body, and poor running costs Pakistan a wicket. Azhar will have himself to blame here. Hafeez has punched this wide of midwicket, they both know the second is on, and they turn around. However, Azhar stops for a second for no reason. By the time Hafeez realises this and stops, Azhar has resumed running. Then by the time Azhar realises that, Hafeez has resumed running. Enugh time lost, and Azhar is run out at the non-striker's end, for 49
looks to work this to leg, gets a leading edge over midwicket
short of a length, walks down the wicket, works this to square leg
steers this down to third man for one
punches this on the move but can't beat the man at cover
down the wicket but can't beat short straight cover
short of a length, can't beat point with the cut
shimmies down to drive this full ball to long-on
short of a length, on off, punched to deep cover
tossed up on off, dropped to the right of point for one
pushed to the left of short cover but can't beat Dilshan there
wide slower ball, left alone, cuts back in, not called a wide
takes this from off and middle and works it to square leg for one
lovely shot. Walks down the pitch to flick this length ball past mid-on. The slow outfield saves two runs for Sri Lanka
short of a length, wide, punched in front of third man for two
short of a length, wide, runs this down to third man for one
that's a gentle-paced short ball, pulled away for a single
on a length, just outside off, opens the face, takes a quick single to short third man. Hafeez is hesitant, but Sarfraz isn't, and that is what matters most of the time in runs behind square
half-volley, driven to long-on for one
down the wicket to push this offbreak past midwicket for one
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
long hop, pulled in front of deep square, the slow outfield keeps them down to two
short of a length, on off, can't beat the man at point
pulled away but can't get it past the man at square leg, standing next to the umpire
slower ball, really full, digs it out to point
bouncer, wide down the leg side, but not called. The umpire reckons it moved down the leg side after passing the stumps
slower ball, short of a length, worked into the leg side
on a length, on off, regulation pace, pushed to short straight midwicket
that's a beauty. Holds its line outside off. Hafeez plays the angle, and is beaten on the outside edge
flighted, driven to long-on for an easy single
down the wicket, Dilshan pulls the length back, but he has managed to work this to leg for one
shortish again, pulled down to long-on for one
nice shot. Down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball, looks to chip it over mid-off, and despite the fact that it holds up in the breeze he manages to clear mid-off and take a couple
flatter, into the pads, worked away for a single
another single into the leg side for one
leaves his crease, not very close to the pitch of the ball and drags this from wide outside off and over midwicket for four
flat, into the pads, pulled away to deep square leg for a single
down the wicket to work this into the leg side for a single
tossed up on off, driven to long-off for one. Played this ball from a guard outside leg. Reminiscent of Saleem Malik and Moin Khan
defended back to him
down the wicket, but not to the pitch of the ball, and ends up pushing this back to the fielder
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
short of a length, outside off, plays with an open face, can't beat point
looks to work this shortish ball to leg, gets an inside edge onto the pad. A muted appeal
holds its line just outside off, squares him up a little
short of a length, headed for top of off, defended from the crease
gets the width to punch this to third man for one
on a length, into the pads, pushed wide of short midwicket for one
looks to run this to third man, but the ball holds its line to beat the outside edge. Is pitched just short of a length and just outside off
manages to run this down to third man for one
another batsman beaten trying to run a ball down to third man. It is short of a length, but not wide enough to attempt that shot
looks to sweep the fast bowler after shuffling across, but gets a top edge over the keeper's head
lovely shot. A wide length ball, punched on the up, past point. Only the slow outfield keeps it inside the boundary
short of a length, outside off, punched straight to point
wide length ball, pushed with an open face, gets a single to third man
pulled away from head high, keeps it down, gets a single to long leg
short-arm pull. Smart shot. Plays according to the field. The two men deep on the leg side are fine leg and square leg, so he goes in front of square with the shot and gets four through midwicket
keeps this pull down and finds the man at midwicket
punched off the hip, between fine leg and deep square leg. The call from Sarfraz is "aa jayein aa jayein aa jayein". Not "aaja aaja". Doesn;t forget the tehzeeb even when calling for a second
slower ball, full and wide, left alone, goes over that tram line. Well done by the umpire to not call it a wide
slower legcutter, wide, driven to deep cover
regulation pace, short ball, pulled to deep square leg. On the first bounce
keeps the pull down, gets a single
slower legcutter, full, just outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, slower ball, gets two fine of fine leg
looks to cut a flat delivery, gets a bottom edge
short of a length, angling in, punched down to long-on
short of a length, on off, punched past point
nearly a yorker, dug out back to him
takes guard way outside leg, looks to work this to off, gets a thick inside edge for a couple. It's a no-ball too. So he gets a free hit now
short of a length, punched to extra cover where Pradeep drops the catch but that doesn't matter because this is a free hit
punches this wide of long-on for one
slower ball, hits the shoulder of his bat, nearly rolls onto the stumps. Hafeez calls him through for a sharp single

lovely shot. Half-volley outside off, driven wide of mid-off, Mathews gets a hand to it with the dive but they get three. Hafeez gets to his fifty after two Pakistan batsmen have been dismissed in their 40s
slower ball, short of a length, pushed to long-on for one
slower ball again, on a length, worked past midwicket for one
guard outside leg again, Malinga bowls a yorker, which the Sarf digs out well
low full toss as the yorker goes wrong and he has punched this wide of midwicket for a couple
tossed up outside off, can't beat the short cover with the push
short of a length, punched to deep cover
short of a length, into the body, punched to deep midwicket for one

slog weep, timed really well too, but he has picked out the man at deep midwicket to perfection. The second Pakistani batsman to pick that man out. Two of three wickets have fallen to a catch at deep midwicket, and the third has run himself out. Hafeez has timed this pretty well, but failed to get the elevation to hit a six. Just a short-arm effort
drives a full ball to long-off to get off the mark
short of a length, flat, punched to deep midwicket for one
short, chest high, keeps it down as he works it to leg for one
yorker, on the toes, clipped away to fine leg for one
slower ball, low full toss, but Sarfraz is trying to play Malinga as late as possible, and hence is in good position to play the slower ball. Turns it to fine leg
yorker outside off, dug out past point
half-volley outside off, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, into the hip, Malik moves inside its line to deflect it fine of fine leg for four
looks to drive him to leg, but can't beat short midwicket
wide down the leg side. Dilshan anticipating Sarf to back away but he doesn't
he backs away this time to open the face in front of the stumps and get a single
stays back to a length, ball, which doesn't turn. Ends up playing it back to Dilshan
down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball, makes a little room too, and drives it between the bowler and mid-off for four
flat, into the pads, defended to midwicket
down the wicket again, this time too close to the pitch of the ball, and gets a single to long-on
short of a length, just outside off, punched past point for one
the stumps might have saved Sri Lanka four runs, or at least two considering the slowness of the outfield. Down the wicket to smack this dead straight, and into the middle stump at the bowler's end
slower legcutter, beats his cut outside off, and rolls along to the keeper
another legcutter, but this time Sarfaraz picks it early and the length is short and he pulls it past midwicket for four
wide slower ball, too wide
slower legcutter, punched to deep cover for one
slower ball, wide, punched wide of deep cover for two
bouncer first up, he ducks it
looks to run a shortish ball fine but is beaten. Just trying to be too cute. Had he looked for a single to third man he wouldn't have missed this
short ball, around off, he pulls this to deep midwicket, gets to his fifty. Fourth Pakistan batsman today to go past 40
this one holds its line in front of off to square him up a little, but the edge brings Malik a single
short again, nicely pulled away into the ground for a single
again a bit of legcut around off, and he can only defend this back to Malinga
Sarfraz looks to sweep him first ball, is too early into the shot, and gets a single off the back of the bat. The ball goes towards third man
makes room to cut this from just outside off, gets a single to deep point
hurried into the pull, but the mis-hit doesn't carry to midwicket. Pathirana doesn't attack it. Who knows this could have been a catch had he moved in in time
slower legcutter, late-cuts it, but can't beat short third man

this time Pathirana can't do anything. Sarfraz is ready for this short ball and pulls this well over midwicket, Pathirana. He will still be thinking of two balls ago when he didn't move in for the catch
gets a top edge on the pull but it doesn't carry to long leg
slower ball outside off, punched to deep cover for one
makes room to punch this to deep cover, takes this from middle and leg
slower ball, picked early, and it is a length ball too, which means it is in the hitting arc. Sarf gets enough on it to clear mid-off. Gets four more. The outfield has got a little faster now
slower ball gone wrong. It is a beamer, which Sarfraz bottom-edges into his own pad
length ball outside off, Malik is a little early into it, the bat turns in his hand, gets him a single to long-on
slower ball, short of a length, no room. Defended back to him
half-volley, just outside off, can't beat extra cover, gets just the single
looks to pull, is a little late, and top-edges it fine of third man for four

another high full toss at Sarfraz, and Pradeep has got away with it. Not called a no-ball although it just a touch higher than waist. Tell you what, this isn't even a slower ball so it is more dangerous than what Malinga was no-balled for
makes room, slaps this bouncer down to long-on for one
slower legcutter, he opens the face, manages to place it fine of third man for a couple
low full toss, into the pads, goes for a single to deep midwicket
makes room, Pradeep follows him with a short ball, Malik is early into the pull and is hit on the arm
and he has to contend with Sarfraz charging at him first ball. Mathews tries to pull the length back, but Sarfraz crashes this past point for a four

and Pakistan throw away another wicket. Sarfraz misses out on a century. Two of the four batsmen dismissed today have been run out. This is hit towards long-on, Sarfraz wants the second but is sent back. He tries to dive in, but is beaten by the direct hit. It is hit softly towards long-on, you can hear Malik's call of "bhag ja bhag ja" before turning back, which means both are thinking two, but when Malik looks up he sees the fielder is on the ball and has no option but to send Sarfraz back. Selfless batting, but nobody's mistake really
pulled away to deep square for one
gets a single to long-on first ball to get off the mark
tucked away off the hip
short of a length, punched to midwicket
short of a length, no room, defended from the crease
down the wicket to punch this in front of deep cover for two
slower legcutter, opens the face, gets a single to third man
shows him the stumps, then shuffles across at the last moment to work this full ball to leg for one
and Perera bowls into the pads with that field. Rizwan works this into the leg side with soft hands and gets a two
low full toss, pushed to mid-off for one
slower short ball, wide outside off, pulled towards deep midwicket for a couple
length ball, into the pads, and again he has placed this between deep midwicket and long-on, and he gets a couple again
another length ball, and another shot between long-on and deep midwicket. That's a third couple in a row. Malik must be feeling the pinch

and that will provide Malik some relief. No need to run here. Mathews provides him the width and short length with the square field on the off side up. He just opens the face to guide this between short third man and point
looks to flick this to leg, gets a single off the outside half of the bat. The ball goes to mid-off
Malik backs away, Mathews bowls short, but he finds the deep cover to be contained to just the single
slower ball, picked early and slogged to deep midwicket for one
slower ball, on a length outside off, he opens the face to get a single to short third man
stays back, picks the slower ball early, slogs this powerfully. Goes catchable height for the deep midwicket, but he has placed it wide of that man. Three ordinary deliveries from Malinga
another slower ball, runs this to short third for one. Not one yorker attempted by the best yorker bowler in the world
makes up his mind early to try to paddle a slower ball past short fine leg, but is done in by the extra bounce, and lets in a rare dot ball
and ends the over with a sixth slower ball wide outside off. Driven to deep point for one
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, he gets just the single to backward point
shuffles across, pulls a short ball straight to deep midwicket
slower short ball, and yet another single as Rizwan's attempt at a late cut fails to beat short third man
Malik backs away, Pradeep follows him with a slower ball, Malik gets back inside the line of the ball, and gets a wide out of it
down the wicket to cut this short ball to deep cover for one
another slower ball gone wrong, wide down the leg side

and this slower ball is a good one. At 109ks, this hardly leaves ground. beats his cut, and rolls along the ground to the keeper. Chandimal throws the ball back to prevent a bye, which Rizwan is not even taking, and hits him in the back
down the wicket, yorks himself up, gets just the single. Overall a good over, with seven runs off it despite the two wides. Good thinking to not give them any pace on a slow outfield
this is the 13th slower ball in a row. On a length, in the slot, and Rizwan is on a knee to slog this over midwicket for a six. First six of the innings. Takes them past 300
and he pre-empts a full quick ball, is down on a knee again, and ramps this low full toss over short fine leg for four more
short ball outside off, pulled to long-on for one
slower ball, on a length, in the slogging zone, and he crashes this between long-on and deep midwicket. Makes room to make the shot possible
yorker finally, outside leg, he has dug it out square of deep midwicket for a couple

lovely shot. Malinga's horror day ends with a half-volley, which Malik chips inside out over extra cover for four more. He is the fifth Pakistan batsman to score at least 40. The only other batsman to have batted today, Rizwan, ends with unbeaten 35 off 22

inn2.comm: on a length, on off, defended from the crease
full, but in to the pads, concedes a leg-bye
half-volley outside off, driven hard into the ground, gets a single to cover
full toss, angling in, helped away to square leg. Sent back by Dilshan, but they get a single off the ricochet from the direct hit
short of a length, middle and off, angling away, and beats the pull with the extra bounce
another full toss, knee high, pushed to mid-off
shot. That's proper intent. A distinct touch of Jayasuriya there. Takes a length ball from outside off and smashes it over wide mid-on. The bottom hand, the bat swing, all Sanath
short of a length, middle and off, seams away a touch to beat his push. Sarfraz fails to make a clean connection
on a length, on off, punched wide of mid-off for one
on a length, swinging in a touch, whipped away past midwicket
inswinging half-volley, nicely clipped away for two. The slow outfield comes to Anwar's rescue
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
short-arm pull as Irfan angles into the pads, All Perera has to do is miss the square leg, and he gets four
short of a length, angling in, dropped into the leg side for one
short of a length, no room, defended from the crease
wide length ball, drives hard at it, between point and cover-point for four
fuller, wider, driven to third man for one
good sharp short ball, hits his glove rather than the bat doing anything, but it doesn't quite carry to that short fine leg, which is more of a leg gully. That is really quick
short of a length, into the body, punched wide of midwicket for two
length ball, angling in, pushed to short midwicket
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover
slower ball, length ball, outside off, pushed to cover-point
driven on the up, straight to mid-off
full and straight, clipped away to short midwicket
full and quick but a wide down the leg side
short of a length, angling in towards top of off, chops on it, and keeps it out
dabs on this, gets it wide of point, takes a single
looks for a drive over cover, is undone by the extra bounce and pace, and he ends up playing it back to Irfan

this short ball has no sting, and Dilshan pulls this over midwicket. The slow outfield means this is not going for four, but Perera is not alert to that. Dilshan really unhappy that he doesn't come through for the this. He lets him know too
offcutter, beats his poke, a slower ball, and it doesn't carry to the keeper
on a length, middle and leg, angling towards off, defended from the crease
low full toss, Perera goes hard at it, gets a thick edge past slip for four
full outside off, gets an inside edge to leg for a single
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover-point

slower ball does the trick here. It is quite full, a half-volley really, just outside off, but Dilshan has no pace to work with it, and all he manages is a hit straight to mid-off. Good defensive bowling from Anwar, and Pakistan have a big wicket
edge first ball. Short of a length, middle and off, angling away, takes the edge, and flies past slip
length ball outside off, left alone
short of a length, seaming in, beats him with pace, hits the pad, but is headed down leg
length ball, dropped wide of midwicket for a single
short of a length, angling in, he shuffles across to work this to deep square for one
short of a length, on off, punched to the right of mid-off for a single
short of a length, angling in, he moves across to defend this in front of off
length ball outside off, hits the inside edge then the pad
slower ball, on a length, on off, punched wide of mid-off for one
length ball outside off, allowed to angle through to the keeper
on a length, just outside off, punched straight to mid-off
slower ball, short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single

Perera is gone. Anwar Ali must love Premadasa. He is doing it with the new ball here again. A big slower ball, should be pretty obvious because he has made a big change-up, but Perera has not picked it and it given it an almighty thump. It means the edge is a healthy one, and Sarfraz pouches it diving it in front of first slip
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover
short of a length, on off, he defends off the back foot
short, wide, superbly cut away in front of point for four. This is cracked away
and short and wide again, and never mind the slow outfield. Thirimanne loves that length and has cut this even more powerfully for four more
full, angling in, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
short of a length, angling in, defended solidly
length ball outside off, gets a thick edge to it for a single to third man
slower ball, short of a length, defended to cover
on a length, on off, defended to cover
offcutter, on the pads, helped away for a single to fine leg
another offcutter, on a length, outside off, driven to cover-point
another slower ball, another edge, but it falls halfway to first slip
short of a length, angling in, tucked away to long leg
short of a length, wide, nicely punched away, but now with the field restrictions over there is a deep point in place
lovely punch shot as Rahat bowls short and provides him width, but the deep point keeps them down to one
good bouncer, chasing him as he tries to sway out of its line. Leaves it alone well in the end
short and wide, cut away hard, and the slow outfield allows deep point to get around and keep them down to two
no appeal. Short of a length, just outside off, seems to have beaten his attempt at a late-cut but the ball deviates away at the same time as it passes the bat. I am surprised there is no appeal
no slip. Lovely offbreak, just outside off, draws the drive, takes the edge but there is no slip
short of a length, middle and off, stays back to defend
another slow offbreak, he stays back to defend again
short of a length, into the pads, pushed to short straight midwicket. Azhar Ali seems to have hurt himself while making this save
tossed up middle and leg, defended back to him
down the wicket to push this full ball to long-on
short of a length, into the ribs, worked to leg for one
length ball, angling in, defended with an open face, gets a single
wide length ball, driven straight to short cover
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg for a single
nice short ball, gets a little big on him, fended in front of the chest
slight nip back in from short of a length and just outside off. Gets an inside edge onto the pad
short of a length, from wide on the crease, punched to long-on for one
slows this one down, gets some turn from middle and leg, defended with an open face
gets a little short, he late-cuts, but can't beat the diving Shehzad at backward point
this time he beats the man. Only slightly flat, not too short, but he goes back deep into the crease and plays a delicate late cut. What's better, he places this finer than the last one
slower through the air, a half-volley really, and Tharanga has driven this exquisitely through extra cover. It takes some timing to send such a slow ball for four on this outfield
drives this flighted delivery to long-off for one
short of a length, wide, punched away uppishly to third man
full, angling in, punched to mid-on
lovely hook shot. This is no mean short ball. Almost head high, and he has pulled this over midwicket for four. Doesn't bother keeping it down
slower ball, too short, he waits for it and runs it down to third man for one
short of a length, angling in, drops this towards cover for one
on a length, into the pads, nicely clipped away between fine leg and deep square
length ball, no turn, defended from the crease
flighted, middle and leg, defended to leg

lovely stumping from Sarfraz. Good bowling first of all as he flights the ball and gets some dip on it. Tharanga is stranded after jumping out of the crease and getting beaten on the inside edge, but the ball has turned and bounced sharply. Sarfraz is unfazed and makes the collection, and completes the stumping
flighted, middle and leg, defended back
legbreak, middle and off, turns past the outside edge
flighted on off, drives this to long-off to break the maiden, but Shah did get the wicket
flighted on off, driven to his left, and he makes a full-length dive to save this. Good fielder off his own bowling
flat, on a length outside off, pushed back to him
short of a length, cut away to deep point for one
nicely played. A length ball, turning in a little, he opens the face late, takes this virtually out of the keeper's gloves and places this fine of short third man
fired down the leg side for a wide. Sarfraz gets behind it, and he has been hit in the knee, and he is down in pain. It has missed the pad and has hit the knee flush
full, middle and leg, dug out towards midwicket
on a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
tossed up outside off, defended to cover
flighted on middle and off, down the wicket to push this to short midwicket
down the wicket again, and this time he manages to get it past the short straight midwicket
flatter into the pads, worked to long leg for one
full, middle and leg, turned to square leg
down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball, works this into the leg side for a single
pitched up and spinning in, defended to the off side
a touch shorter, but again tight around off, patted back towards the bowler
comes down the track and looks to whip the ball to the leg side, he is deceived by the flight, the ball spins in and hits the pad, Thirimanne was yards down

a big lbw appeal, turned down, will they go for the review? They discuss it, but they don't, Thirimanne went for the sweep but he missed, was struck on the thigh pad outside off, that ball wasn't even going on to hit the stumps
on the pads, clipped behind square leg for a single
eased towards long-off, just two off the over
pitching on middle and leg, defended to the leg side
nice turn for Yasir, the ball zipping away gets the edge, but the ball drops just short of first slip
doesn't matter, as Mathews is gone next ball, he charges out and looks to thrash that over long-on, gets the leading edge and that is taken at long-off, is this game over?
pitching on a length on off stump, worked towards cover for a single
again Yasir draws the edge, gets the ball to spin away after pitching outside off, the ball flies past slip
a touch short and that is chopped towards point, another quiet over
skips down the track and taps the ball towards long-on for a single
looks to chop this one, but the ball comes in from round the wicket, there isn't much room for Chandimal, he can't get the ball too far
slapped towards point for a single this time
full and wide, squeezed out towards deep point
back of a length ball, turning away, defended by Chandimal
nealry yorked there, a full ball, Chandimal was moving across the stumps, has to dig that one out, manages ot get it away towards point
full and on the pads, glanced towards fine leg for a couple
better line this time, pitching just outside off, driven towards long-off for a single
on the pads, clipped towards square leg, straight at the fielder which means there's no run
spinning down the leg side, helped along towards fine leg, not a clean stop by Mohammad Irfan, two runs taken
full, Thirimanne skips down the track and eases the ball towards long-on for a single
a touch short, pushed towards cover, no run there but a decent over for Sri Lanka
full and wide, Thirimanne reaches out for that one, and gets it away towards backward point for a couple
driven towards long-on for a single
spins in with the arm, don't think Chandimal picked that, he was looking to drive towards off, hits the pad but that was going down the leg stump
this one is patted back towards the bowler
and again, Wasim keeping it tight here
after two deliveries around off stump, Wasim gives room this time, slapped away for a couple
flighted on off, driven to deep cover for one
down the wicket, too close to the pitch of the ball, plays this back to the bowler
wide outside leg, through the legs of the keeper too. Not called wide. Just byes. That is a surprising call. Perhaps because this is a googly, and it is coming in a little
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
flighted outside off, pushed to short cover
uses soft hands this time, drops this wide of cover for one
low full toss, flicked wide of short midwicket for a couple
short, wide, punched to deep cover
flat, into the body, punched to long-on for one
on a length, no turn, hits the inside half of the bat
full, flat into the pads, beats the inside edge
short of a length, cut away for a single
flighted outside off, driven to deep cover for one
legbreak, into the pads, worked away for a single
no turn this time, goes off the inside edge for a single
slower through the air, nice legbreak, but Thirimanne plays it late and deflects it fine of short fine leg
this one doesn't turn outside off, takes the edge, but the single brings up the fifty for Thirimanne. Sri Lanka need more from him
legbreak, opens the face, gets a single past short third man
down the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball, ends up dragging this to long-on. Gets two because he has hit this straight of Irfan, who is fielding at long-on
on a length, flat, straight, defended
down the wicket and flicks this to long-on. They now have Malik fielding there
flat, into the pads, punched to long-on for one
looking to push down the wicket, Wasim remains flat and quick, defended to cover

first wicket for Wasim. He has built the pressure with accurate bowling, and now gets the reward. Chandimal is looking to manufacture the sweep because they haven't hit a boundary for more than 12 overs and there is no man deep behind square on the leg side. But he has moved too far across and exposed the leg stump. Castled as he misses it
down the wicket, turns this into a low full toss, but plays it back to Shah
big legbreak but it starts around leg stump and turns further down. Called wide, but Sarfraz makes a good collection
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep point
quick length ball, no room, but he manages to open the face and takes a single
flighted on off, opens the face, gets a single
legbreak, on the pads, worked to square leg
on a length, just outside off, defended back to him. Not much turn
flat, into the pads, worked away for one
flat, outside off, punched to long-off for one
fuller, just outside off, played back to Wasim
tossed up outside off, punched to deep point
fired in, around off, he keeps it out. Significantly quicker
quick again, 93ks, driven to long-off for one
flighted outside off, gets sharp turn to beat the outside edge
slightly short, goes deep into the crease to punch this straight of deep midwicket
flighted, clipped away to deep midwicket
offbreak, but too short, worked away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, goes back, cuts it away, but can't beat point
short of a length again, but no pace to work with. Opens the face but creates no separation with backward point

don't captains love those days when a bowling change brings about a wicket first ball? Rahat Ali comes on, bowls short of a length, just outside off, Thirimanne looks to open the face, manages only a loopy edge, and Sarfraraz does the rest. Slower ball it is
on a length, on off, pushed to short cover
a length into the pads, Siriwardene gets off the mark with a couple into the leg side

another wicket. Inexperience of the batsman and the experience of Malik both at play. Siriwardene pushes this straight to mid-on - no soft hands, no mis-hit, just straight to mid-on - and sets off for a single. Provided it is Siri's call, but this is a horrendous call and he is sent back. Malik sees the batsman is too far down the wicket, waits for Sarfraz to reach the stumps, and then throws on the bounce. Gone
short of a length, outside off, defended from the crease
slower ball outside off, called wide as it has slipped wide of the tram line
slower ball, just outside off, defended from the crease
pushed back to the bowler
full, into the pads, worked into the leg side
slow through the air, stays back to defend this
tossed up on off, defended from the crease
slow in the air, half-volley, driven to short cover
short of a length, goes deep into the crease and punches this past short midwicket for two
bouncer, on the stumps, swerves away from him at the last moment, but he takes it well with a diver
offcutter, on a length, headed towards top of off, defended from the crease
bouncer again, at the stumps, ducks it
nice short ball, just outside off, Perera stays inside the line
on a length, angling in, pushed towards mid-on for a single
another bouncer, head high, Pathirana keeps it down with the pull, takes a single
flat, into the pads, worked to leg but not past midwicket
that's a long hop, asking to be hit, and Pathirana does that for a six over square leg. The first boundary since the 15th over
short, cut away, gets a couple
flat length ball, defended from the crease
slower through the air, defended from the crease
full, nearly a yorker, dug out to short cover
full, into the pads, clipped away for one
slower ball outside off, runs this down to third man
bouncer, at the stumps, he ducks it. Too high
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot with an open face, gets a single
angling in, he shuffles across to work this to long leg
slower offcutter, pushed towards mid-on, this time Perera has been sent back when looking for a single
full, on off, dug out to cover
starts with a slider. Pathirana hasn't picked it, and is beaten on the outside edge
legbreak, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
nice legbreak, from just outside off, beats the inside edge, draws a huge lbw shout, but he seems to have been hit just outside the line
googly to beat him on the outside edge
quick slider, defended to cover
quicker, flatter, a bit like Warne's flipper. Kept out by Perera
short of a length, on off, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, quite quick, chest high, and Perera fends after shaping to duck it
tucked away off the hip for one
full, nearly a yorker, dug out to mid-off
short of a length, just outside off, keeps it out
nicely runs this shortish delivery square of third man for two
down the wicket to drive this really full delivery straight to mid=off
nice slow legbreak, defended off the front foot
flatter quicker legbreak, down the leg, and kisses the pad on the way to Sarfraz
full, on the pads, gets a single to long-on
short, but quick, and takes the bottom edge on the pull. The ricochet off the pad lands safe
down the wicket, close to the pitch of the ball, gets a single to deep midwicket
full, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
slower ball, catches him on the crease, but the bat comes down in time to defend this length ball
bouncer, on top of off, he sways out of its line and stays down
that's nearly plumb. Yorker followed by a bouncer, which hits him in front but seems to be headed down leg. Not given. No review taken
slower ball, cuts into the ribs, defended from the crease
full toss, hits the bat hard, and is defended back to him

and he gets one more wicket. Teases Perera with a slow flighted delivery. Perera's favourite zone is that wide long=on, and he finally goes for that shot. But he is not close to the pitch of the ball, and manages just a massive top edge, which is caught at the boundary
short, flat, quick, pulled to deep midwicket
slow teasing legbreak, draws an edge, but it goes down and wide of gully for a single

what a piece of brilliance from Anwar Ali to give Shah his fourth and bring this game closer to its end. They have gone to the third umpire but the soft signal is out. Pathirana is down the wicket to hit this flat and low towards deep midwicket, Anwar Ali charges in from his post at the boundary, and he has run in quite a bit, and then dives forward to take this centimetres from the ground. And after watching a few replays, the third umpire has decided there is no evidence to overutrn the soft signal of out. And it looks like a clean catch too
tossed up on off, defended off the front foot
sharp legbreak, on off, turning away, beats the edge. No five-for for Shah, but superb figures: 10-1-29-4
Pradeep is backing away, opens the face to a full toss, gets a single to third man
bouncer, middle and leg, Maling stays out of its line
full and straight, defended to mid-off

without a dropped catch, how would this be a Pakistan match? Malinga just backs away and slogs, gets the top edge on the pull, Azhar Ali runs back from mid-off, gets under it, but the ball pops out. Also Irfan has overstepped, a fact the umpire has not picked
Malinga is backing away again, gets a full toss that he hits past cover
bowls a no-ball. Short of a length, angling in, defended
full on the free hit, Pradeep makes room and lofts this over mid-off
arm ball to end the match. The debutant does it. This is a length ball on off, Malinga plays for the turn, the ball comes in to beat the inside edge and hits the stumps
